intro: Adenostegia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-stemmed adenostegia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Adenostegia laxiflora is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
